To clarify, the k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN) is a machine learning algorithm that belongs to the instance-based learning category. This method is used for both classification and regression problems. The basic idea behind this technique is to classify an unknown data point based on the majority class of its 'k' nearest neighbors in the training dataset, where 'k' is user-defined.
